column1: How were your overall mentorship training and support experience in OLS?
column2: What expectations from the OLS program were met and where can we do better?
column3: How was your overall experience with the mentoring calls with your mentee?
column4: If you followed the cohort calls (notes or videos), which of the following topics introduced in these cohort calls were useful for you?
column5: Would you be interested in returning to the next cohort as a mentor or expert, and/or join our steering committee?
column6: Anything else you would like to share with us?

column1: I felt supported as a mentor and the training offered in the OLS-1 was adequate
column2: My expectations were to get to know other people interested in this kind of work, and to learn specifically from - and with - my mentee about these topics. Both of these things happened. My mentee and I struggled in our communication somewhat, I suspect because our cultural backgrounds were so very different. However, I am still very happy that we worked together.
column4: Tooling and Roadmapping (open canvas, project vision etc.), Open agenda and social calls
column5: Yes I'd like to return as a mentor

column1: I felt supported as a mentor but the training offered in the OLS-1 can be improved, I enjoyed my participation and did not find the experience overwhelming
column4: Licensing and Code of Conduct, Mountain of engagement and Community interactions
column5: Yes I'd like to return as a mentor

column1: I felt supported as a mentor but the training offered in the OLS-1 can be improved
column2: I think some more prep calls ahead of the programme would be useful especially for those who are not familiar with the syllabus
column4: Mountain of engagement and Community interactions, Final presentation rehearsals, Final presentation call (open and live streamed)
column5: Yes I'd like to return as a mentor

column1: I felt supported as a mentor and the training offered in the OLS-1 was adequate, I enjoyed my participation and did not find the experience overwhelming
column2: The mentorship program wad well organized: sufficient support to both mentors and mentees, clear and timely communications etc. Great work!
column3: Mentoring calls were somewhat constructive, Mentoring calls were mostly constructive
column4: Tooling and Roadmapping (open canvas, project vision etc.), Licensing and Code of Conduct, GitHub and README files, Knowledge Dissemination: Citizen science, open education, Preprints, open protocols, Mountain of engagement and Community interactions, Persona and pathways and inviting contributions, Final presentation call (open and live streamed)
column5: I am not sure yet but ask me later
column6: Thank you for the amazing work you did with OLS. Excited about the continued impact and community you are building.

column1: I felt supported as a mentor but the training offered in the OLS-1 can be improved
column2:
it would have been helpful for me to chat more with the other mentors, even about practicalities of how to use the website, calendar, gitter, slack, docs, etc to make things streamlined for me. I was lost in the web of things, and didn't give this enough attention to get organised (that's on me!)

I felt distant - but it's been a tough time. In normal times & with more energy dedicated to this, I think what you have already would be enough!
column5: Yes, but I don't know how yet! Could be any of the three ways...

column1: I felt supported as a mentor and the training offered in the OLS-1 was adequate, I enjoyed my participation and did not find the experience overwhelming
column2: I felt quite well-matched with my mentees, in terms of the project they were working on and the kind of guidance they needed. I would have liked a clearer process through which to connect with an expert/experts and invite them to join a meeting with mentees. Maybe that info exists already somewhere already and i simply missed it.
column5: Yes I'd like to return as an expert

column1: I felt supported as a mentor and the training offered in the OLS-1 was adequate
column2: I really enjoyed the whole experience.
column4: I didn't have the time to attend all of these calls - but all looked really helpful.
column5: Yes I'd like to return as a mentor

column1: I missed out on some mentor trainings (due to scheduling conflicts, and my feeling comfortable from previous experience mentoring for MozOL), but the ones I attended were great!
column2:
I think it was a great program -- speaking as a mentor where dealing with OLS is adjacent to my day job, I would ask for nudges in the direction of:
1. formatting and structuring in e-mails to call out deadlines and action items
2. converging on digital platforms for communications, and collating links through the website or a central google doc
column5: I am not sure yet but ask me later
